about.description:
Jinja is a fast, expressive, extensible templating engine. Special
placeholders in the template allow writing code similar to Python
syntax. Then the template is passed data to render the final document.

It includes:

-   Template inheritance and inclusion.
-   Define and import macros within templates.
-   HTML templates can use autoescaping to prevent XSS from untrusted
    user input.
-   A sandboxed environment can safely render untrusted templates.
-   AsyncIO support for generating templates and calling async
    functions.
-   I18N support with Babel.
-   Templates are compiled to optimized Python code just-in-time and
    cached, or can be compiled ahead-of-time.
-   Exceptions point to the correct line in templates to make debugging
    easier.
-   Extensible filters, tests, functions, and even syntax.

Jinja's philosophy is that while application logic belongs in Python if
possible, it shouldn't make the template designer's job difficult by
restricting functionality too much.
about.summary: A very fast and expressive template engine.

name: jinja2
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.1.6" %}

package:
  name: jinja2
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/j/jinja2/jinja2-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0137fb05990d35f1275a587e9aee6d56da821fc83491a0fb838183be43f66d6d

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv --no-build-isolation

requirements:
  host:
    - flit-core <4
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
  run:
    - markupsafe >=2.0
    - python >={{ python_min }}

test:
  imports:
    - jinja2
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}

about:
  home: https://palletsprojects.com/p/jinja/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: A very fast and expressive template engine.
  description: |
    Jinja is a fast, expressive, extensible templating engine. Special
    placeholders in the template allow writing code similar to Python
    syntax. Then the template is passed data to render the final document.

    It includes:

    -   Template inheritance and inclusion.
    -   Define and import macros within templates.
    -   HTML templates can use autoescaping to prevent XSS from untrusted
        user input.
    -   A sandboxed environment can safely render untrusted templates.
    -   AsyncIO support for generating templates and calling async
        functions.
    -   I18N support with Babel.
    -   Templates are compiled to optimized Python code just-in-time and
        cached, or can be compiled ahead-of-time.
    -   Exceptions point to the correct line in templates to make debugging
        easier.
    -   Extensible filters, tests, functions, and even syntax.

    Jinja's philosophy is that while application logic belongs in Python if
    possible, it shouldn't make the template designer's job difficult by
    restricting functionality too much.
  doc_url: https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/
  dev_url: https://github.com/pallets/jinja/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jakirkham
    - msarahan
    - scopatz
    - nehaljwani
    - xylar
    - bollwyvl
